p: According to the differences of major FAs in seeds, the oil crops could be divided into several subclasses ( Table 1). In B. napus, O. sativa, and H. annuus the major FA is OA; thus they belong to the OA subclass. For the G. max, Z. mays, and P. abies, LA is the richest FA, so they belong to the LA subclass. L. usitatissimum and P. frustescens belong to the ALA subclass for their high content of ALA. The unsaturated fatty acids are catalyzed by a class of fatty acid desaturases (FADs).
